channel.title: CVE Feed for Mitsubishi Electric -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Mitsubishi Electric -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-12007|2024-08-04T11:48:57.519Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- mc%20works64
item.description: A specially crafted communication packet sent to the affected devices could allow remote code execution and a denial-of-service condition due to a deserialization vulnerability. This issue affects: Mitsubishi Electric MC Works64 version 4.02C (10.95.208.31) and earlier, all versions; Mitsubishi Electric MC Works32 version 3.00A (9.50.255.02); ICONICS GenBroker64, Platform Services, Workbench, FrameWorX Server version 10.96 and prior; ICONICS GenBroker32 version 9.5 and prior.

item.title: CVE-2020-14521|2024-08-04T12:46:34.835Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- c%20controller%20interface%20module%20utility
item.description: Multiple Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation engineering software products have a malicious code execution vulnerability. A malicious attacker could use this vulnerability to obtain information, modify information, and cause a denial-of-service condition.

item.title: CVE-2020-12013|2024-08-04T11:48:57.506Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- mc%20works64
item.description: A specially crafted WCF client that interfaces to the may allow the execution of certain arbitrary SQL commands remotely. This affects: Mitsubishi Electric MC Works64 Version 4.02C (10.95.208.31) and earlier, all versions; Mitsubishi Electric MC Works32 Version 3.00A (9.50.255.02); ICONICS GenBroker64, Platform Services, Workbench, FrameWorX Server v10.96 and prior; ICONICS GenBroker32 v9.5 and prior.

item.title: CVE-2020-12015|2024-08-04T11:48:57.726Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- mc%20works64
item.description: A specially crafted communication packet sent to the affected systems could cause a denial-of-service condition due to improper deserialization. This issue affects: Mitsubishi Electric MC Works64 version 4.02C (10.95.208.31) and earlier, all versions; Mitsubishi Electric MC Works32 version 3.00A (9.50.255.02); ICONICS GenBroker64, Platform Services, Workbench, FrameWorX Server version 10.96 and prior; ICONICS GenBroker32 version 9.5 and prior.

item.title: CVE-2020-16226|2024-08-04T13:37:54.189Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- qj71mes96
item.description: Multiple Mitsubishi Electric products are vulnerable to impersonations of a legitimate device by a malicious actor, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary commands.

item.title: CVE-2020-12009|2024-08-04T11:48:57.050Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- mc%20works64
item.description: A specially crafted communication packet sent to the affected device could cause a denial-of-service condition due to a deserialization vulnerability. This affects: Mitsubishi Electric MC Works64 Version 4.02C (10.95.208.31) and earlier, all versions; Mitsubishi Electric MC Works32 Version 3.00A (9.50.255.02); ICONICS GenBroker64, Platform Services, Workbench, FrameWorX Server v10.96 and prior; ICONICS GenBroker32 v9.5 and prior.

item.title: CVE-2020-14523|2024-08-04T12:46:34.640Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- cw%20configurator
item.description: Multiple Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation products have a vulnerability that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2020-14496|2024-08-04T12:46:34.676Z -- mitsubishi%20electric -- cpu%20module%20logging%20configuration%20tool
item.description: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability for multiple Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation Engineering Software Products of various versions could allow an attacker to escalate privilege and execute malicious programs, which could cause a denial-of-service condition, and allow information to be disclosed, tampered with, and/or destroyed.
